Title: Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI)
Description:
**Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI)**
 
NDVI is a key indicator used in remote sensing to measure vegetation health. It works by comparing how plants reflect light in two specific spectral bands: near-infrared (NIR) and red light. The NDVI formula Which uses the difference between near-infrared (NIR) and red reflectance divided by their sum (NIR - Red) / (NIR + Red).

**** Interpreting NDVI**** 
NDVI values range from -1 to 1. Healthy and denser vegetation reflects more NIR and absorbs more red: meaning it has **higher NDVI values**, while bare soil, water, or unhealthy vegetation have **lower NDVI values**.
